Class GrundyRecGplusGequalsP

java.lang.Object
GrundyRecGplusGequalsP
class GrundyRecGplusGequalsP extends Object
Grundy Game with AI for the machine This program is an update of grundyRecPerdantNeutre, we improve the simplification of the game board by using the type of piles This version is faster than the previous one because we improve the simplification of the game board so we decrease the number of calculation

    (package private) int[]
    type
    Type of each piles ( up to 50 ) ( 5 possible types : 0, 1, 2, 3, 4 )

    • playerEditMatchsticks

      void playerEditMatchsticks(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, String playerName)
      Allows the player to modify the number of matchsticks in a pile. The player cannot remove all the matchsticks from a pile.
      Parameters:
      jeu - List representing the piles of matchsticks.
      playerName - The player's name.

    • robotEditMatchsticks

      Edit the matchsticks for the robot
      Parameters:
      jeu - the table of matchsticks

    • robotPlayedRandom

      void robotPlayedRandom(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      Allows the robot to play by randomly removing matchsticks, while respecting the rule of not creating two equal piles.
      Parameters:
      jeu - List representing the piles of matchsticks.

    • jouerGagnant

      boolean jouerGagnant(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      Plays the winning move if it exists
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      Returns:
      true if there is a winning move, false otherwise

    • estPerdante

      boolean estPerdante(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      RECURSIVE method that indicates if the configuration (of the current game or trial game) is losing. This method is used by the machine to know if the opponent can lose (100%).
      Parameters:
      jeu - current game board (the state of the game at a certain moment during the game)
      Returns:
      true if the configuration (of the game) is losing, false otherwise

    • estConnuePerdante

      boolean estConnuePerdante(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      Indicates if the configuration is know as loosing by checking if the game board is in the list of losing positions.
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      Returns:
      true if the configuration is losing, false otherwise

    • estConnueGagnante

      boolean estConnueGagnante(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      Indicates if the configuration is know as wining by checking if the game board is in the list of wining positions.
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      Returns:
      true if the configuration is losing, false otherwise

    • sortGame

      ArrayList<Integer> sortGame(ArrayList<Integer> game)
      Sort the game board by ascending order and remove the piles with 1 or 2 matchsticks.
      Parameters:
      game - game board
      Returns:
      the game board sorted

    • simplifyGameBoard

      ArrayList<Integer> simplifyGameBoard(ArrayList<Integer> gameSorted)
      Remove all loosing piles from the game board and remove winning piles with the same type It's recommanded to give the game board already sorted
      Parameters:
      gameSorted - game board sorted
      Returns:
      the game board without loosing piles

    • convertPileToType

      ArrayList<Integer> convertPileToType(ArrayList<Integer> game)
      Convert the game board from the number of matchsticks to the type of piles
      Parameters:
      game - game board
      Returns:
      the game board with the type of piles if the type is not in the dicoType we put -1

    • estGagnante

      boolean estGagnante(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      Indicates if the configuration is winning. Method that simply call "estPerdante".
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      Returns:
      true if the configuration is winning, false otherwise

    • enlever

      void enlever(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, int ligne, int nb)
      Splits a pile of matchsticks from a line in the game (1 line = 1 pile). The new pile is necessarily placed at the end of the list. The pile that is split decreases by the number of matchsticks removed.
      Parameters:
      jeu - list of matchsticks per line
      ligne - pile for which the matchsticks must be split
      nb - number of matchsticks REMOVED from the pile (line) during the split

    • estPossible

      boolean estPossible(ArrayList<Integer> jeu)
      Tests if it is possible to split one of the piles
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      Returns:
      true if there is at least one pile with 3 or more matchsticks, false otherwise

    • premier

      int premier(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, ArrayList<Integer> jeuEssai)
      Creates an initial trial configuration from the game
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      jeuEssai - new configuration of the game
      Returns:
      the number of the pile divided into two or (-1) if there is no pile with at least 3 matchsticks

    • suivant

      int suivant(ArrayList<Integer> jeu, ArrayList<Integer> jeuEssai, int ligne)
      Generates the next trial configuration (i.e., a possible decomposition)
      Parameters:
      jeu - game board
      jeuEssai - trial configuration of the game after splitting
      ligne - the number of the pile that was last split
      Returns:
      the number of the pile divided into two for the new configuration, -1 if no further decomposition is possible
